title: The Baron In Black
opening: Having overcome countless obstacles, Leif finally stood before the gates of Castle Munster. Better known today as "the Twofold Traitor's Lair," the castle towered above the city, intimidating the Liberation Army with its sheer size. Once, Leif had fled these very walls as a mere fugitive, but now he returned as a conqueror. He stood ready to rescue a lost loved one—and in so doing, usher in a new era...

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Raydrik, do I hear correctly that you've allowed those rebels to invade the castle?

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Ah... If Your Eminence would grant me more time, I'll see to it that the vermin are wiped out.

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Don't promise more than you're capable of. It's obvious to anyone with eyes that the rebels have the overwhelming advantage.

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Even for you, this is pathetic. I thought you'd at least be more useful than this, but it seems I overestimated you. I wash my hands of you, Raydrik. Our alliance has come to an end.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Wait, Bishop Veld! Please! If you abandon me now, I... I...

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Not above begging, are we? Oh, very well... I'll consider this a dead man's last request. I shall spare you a battalion of sorcerers from the esteemed Schwarze Rosen.

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: Don't let your guard down, Prince. There aren't many of Raydrik's men left, but he's made up the difference by hiring a slew of sellswords. The most dangerous of them all is a swordsman by the name of Galzus. Challenging him directly is suicide.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Galzus, you say? Hmm... What should we do about him, then?

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: Our only option is to lure him close enough for me to ambush him with the Tome of Forseti. Yet even I don't know if that will defeat him...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: We barely have enough troops to stage such a diversion... August, why did you insist on splitting our army in three?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Divide and conquer, of a sort. The second group is to rescue the children, and the third will arrest the Loptian bishops. As their tasks are a race against time, that was all the more reason to send them in ahead of us.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Rescuing the children goes without saying, but why bother with the Loptian bishops?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: There's a place of worship in the east wing of the castle where the Loptians congregate. The bishops there pose a grave threat to our army, as they wield Berserk and Sleep staves.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I see... So the task of defeating Raydrik falls solely to our group, then?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Indeed. There won't be time for the others to circle back around and rejoin us.

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: We're certainly in for a difficult battle, Prince Leif... Leave the weaker foes to me. You just focus on Raydrik!

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Understood! No matter what it takes, I'll cut him down!

intro.speaker: Saias
intro.line: Raydrik has few soldiers left, Prince, but stay alert: more sellswords yet await us in the castle's halls. The most dangerous of them all is a swordsman by the name of Galzus. Challenging him directly is suicide.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Galzus, you say? Hmm... What should we do about him, then?

intro.speaker: Saias
intro.line: I can't guarantee this, but if you still have that young woman Mareeta with you, we may be able to avoid fighting him altogether. Galzus appears to have some sort of deep bond with the girl...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Then Mareeta could be—Wait! August, why did you insist on splitting our army in three?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Divide and conquer, of a sort. The second group is to rescue the children, and the third will arrest the Loptian bishops. As their tasks are a race against time, that was all the more reason to send them in ahead of us.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Rescuing the children goes without saying, but why bother with the Loptian bishops?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: There's a place of worship in the east wing of the castle where the Loptians congregate. The bishops there pose a grave threat to our army, as they wield Berserk and Sleep staves.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I see... So the task of defeating Raydrik falls solely to our group, then?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Indeed. There won't be time for the others to circle back around and rejoin us.

intro.speaker: Saias
intro.line: This moment was inevitable... We're certainly in for a difficult battle, Prince Leif, but remember: you're not alone. I'll do everything in my power to help—you just focus on Raydrik!

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Understood! No matter what it takes, I'll cut him down!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Raydrik has nearly run out of men, my prince, but take heed: countless sellswords yet await us in the castle's halls.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: If Raydrik still has so many troops, why did you insist on splitting our army in three?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Divide and conquer, of a sort. The second group is to rescue the children, and the third will arrest the Loptian bishops. As their tasks are a race against time, that was all the more reason to send them in ahead of us.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Rescuing the children goes without saying, but why bother with the Loptian bishops?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: There's a place of worship in the east wing of the castle where the Loptians congregate. The bishops there pose a grave threat to our army, as they wield Berserk and Sleep staves.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I see... So the task of defeating Raydrik falls solely to our group, then?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Indeed. There won't be time for the others to circle back around and rejoin us. We're certainly in for a difficult battle, my prince, but we've been in worse situations. I know you have the strength to prevail!

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I do! No matter what it takes, I'll cut Raydrik down!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mareeta
recruit-talk.line: It's you... The swordsman that rescued me... I always hoped I'd see you again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Galzus
recruit-talk.line: What'd you come back here for?! You're still just a little girl... Swords ain't toys, you know!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mareeta
recruit-talk.line: Back then, when I was possessed by that cursed blade, I had a vision of my father. We were separated when I was very young, but I still remember him clearly. He was a towering mountain of a man, strong as an ox, and yet... gentle. Galzus the sellsword... You're... It's you! You're my father!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mareeta
recruit-talk.line: Why aren't you saying anything?! Please! Please, just answer me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mareeta
recruit-talk.line: I'm the one to blame... Those slavers only caught hold of me because I didn't listen to you. Besides, I wasn't their prisoner for very long. Commander Eyvel rescued me just after it happened. I never held a grudge against you, Father!

recruit-talk.speaker: Galzus
recruit-talk.line: ...I'm sorry. I searched for a long, long time, but you never turned up... Besides, with the man I am now... with all the blood I've got on my hands... I figured it was better if you didn't have anything to do with me, wherever you were.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mareeta
recruit-talk.line: Just like that...?! It doesn't matter what's happened since then! We'll always be family...!

recruit-talk.speaker: Galzus
recruit-talk.line: ......That lady, the swordswoman who got turned to stone... She's the one who rescued you from those slavers, right? The one who's raised you ever since?

recruit-talk.speaker: Galzus
recruit-talk.line: ......Then there's no way I'm leavin' her behind. A man of Isaach always repays his debts!

battle.speaker: Child
battle.line: Huh? This door sure is strange, ain't it?

battle.speaker: Child
battle.line: Oh! Uh... I guess it's busted... Heeey, guys! Wait for meee!

boss.speaker: Raydrik
boss.line: I saw your grandfather die! I watched your father's castle burn! I outlived them and I'll outlive you!

boss.speaker: Raydrik
boss.line: Ugggh...! This is... absurd... How could... these... children... Bishop Veld... I beg of you... I don't want... to die... Help... me...

recruit-battle.speaker: Galzus
recruit-battle.line: Fate must really have it out for you, makin' your path cross mine...

recruit-battle.speaker: Galzus
recruit-battle.line: Tch... Being at the mercy of an enemy... I've fallen so far...

end.speaker: August
end.line: We fought for every inch, but Castle Munster is ours. Bards will sing of this battle for years to come.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: But is Raydrik really dead, August? After the finishing blow was dealt, his body just vanished.

end.speaker: August
end.line: Some wicked force is at work here, of that I have no doubt. The whole castle is enveloped in a foul energy... I suspect it's connected to the secret temple of the Loptr Church, which lies underneath this very castle. Until that vile place is reduced to rubble, we cannot consider Munster truly liberated.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: A secret temple... So this is the Loptians' stronghold in Thracia.

end.speaker: August
end.line: Indeed. The man in charge of the temple is a bishop named Veld—he's a close friend and confidant to Manfroy himself.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Bishop Veld... What kind of man is he?

end.speaker: August
end.line: He leads the parish of Loptians that infest Thracia with their presence. It is his responsibility to oversee the region's child hunts—and to sic the Schwarze Rosen on any villages who resist. Raydrik was little more than Veld's pawn. And according to the prisoners we've rescued since, it was he who turned Lady Eyvel to stone.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Wh-What?! That's... That's unforgivable! This man, Veld... He's the spider at the center of it all...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Speaking of which, August... Now that Eyvel's rescue is within our grasp, what can we do to cure her?

end.speaker: August
end.line: As I mentioned before, the Staff of Kia could free her, but only those of Manfroy's bloodline can wield it. We're no closer to finding a solution to that dilemma than when we first fled Castle Munster...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: So after all this, we're still just as powerless?! We can't save Eyvel...?! Argh... Was all this just a waste?!

end.speaker: Sara
end.line: Nothing's been wasted, silly. I'm right here. I'll use the staff.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Sara...?! You don't mean... How can you use the staff?!

end.speaker: Sara
end.line: Because I know how the seal works. I mean, it was Grandfather that sealed it up in the first place, so...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Grandfather...? It can't be... Sara, you're Manfroy's granddaughter?!

end.speaker: Sara
end.line: Don't make me talk about Grandfather... I never liked him. He was such a weird man. Let's just hurry up and save your friend. Don't forget the staff, Lord Leif!
